definition: stick/club/cudgel/smart/capable/strong/wonderful/classifier for legs of a relay race
stick/club/cudgel/smart/capable/strong/wonderful/classifier for legs of a relay race

sentences.english: This building in New York's Columbus Circle is dubbed the 'lollipop' building for obvious reasons.
sentences.chinese: 這個建築被冠以“棒棒糖”的名號是有原因的。

sentences.english: Used to be that sick kids got lollypops after a visit with the doctor.
sentences.chinese: 每次看完醫生後，小孩子就會得到棒棒糖做獎勵。

sentences.english: My sister loves lollipops with teddy bear design.
sentences.chinese: 姊姊喜歡喫畫有小熊圖案的棒棒糖。

sentences.english: We’re getting you fruit and a lollipop. There’s no milk in that.
sentences.chinese: “我們去買水果糖和棒棒糖，那裏面沒有牛奶”。

sentences.english: Rainbow grow after ston, will be sweety as a loll…
sentences.chinese: 彩虹經歷過風雨後的成長，將會像棒棒糖一樣甜美。

sentences.english: Buy some lollipops for you and me.
I ate popcorn, cornflakes, banana and lollipop.
sentences.chinese: 我吃了爆米花，玉米片，香蕉和棒棒糖。

sentences.english: And I will buy two lollipops.
You look, she that piece of face-lifting 200 face , the leg is so thin that the leg resemble lollipop.
sentences.chinese: 你們看，她那張整容兩百次的臉，腿細得像棒棒糖。

sentences.english: The orange street lamps are crumpled toffee-wrappers glued to lollipop sticks.
sentences.chinese: 橙色的路燈燈光就像棒棒糖有褶皺包裝紙一樣粘附着。

sentences.english: Papa's gonna buy you a lollipop.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸會去給你買一個棒棒糖。

sentences.english: I bought lollipops and a toot-toot bugle .
sentences.chinese: 我給她買了棒棒糖，一吹就嗚的打響的小喇叭。

sentences.english: He crammed as many candy bars into his pockets as they would hold.
sentences.chinese: 他儘量把棒棒糖塞進口袋，到裝不下爲止。

sentences.english: And the third man answered, with a sly grin, "I'm a lollipop salesman!"
sentences.chinese: 第三個男人狡猾的笑答，“我是一個棒棒糖推銷員。”

sentences.english: They're also two to three times more expensive than a candy bar at $2 to $3 a bar.
sentences.chinese: 它們也比棒棒糖貴二到三倍，每根要2到3美元。

definition: soft candy (gummi candy, gumdrop, jellybean etc)
sugar-coated Chinese hawthorn or other fruit on a stick/tanghulu
